sentences.en: Anthony dismounted with his camera and walked away from the walls to compose a shot.
sentences.cn: 安东尼拿着照相机下了车，走向离城墙更远的地方，为拍摄构图。

sentences.en: Barrington has composed the music for a new production of ‘A Midsummer Night’s Dream’.
sentences.cn: 巴林顿为新版的《仲夏夜之梦》谱了曲。

sentences.en: Cale also uses electronic keyboards to compose.
sentences.cn: 凯尔也用电子键盘谱曲。

sentences.en: England, Scotland and Wales compose the island of Great Britain.
sentences.cn: 英格兰 、 苏格兰和威尔士构成大不列颠岛.

sentences.en: He lay back on the bed and tried to compose himself.
sentences.cn: 他躺在床上,尽力使自已安定下来.

sentences.en: He started at once to compose a reply to Anna.
sentences.cn: 他马上开始给安娜写回信。

sentences.en: I heard he ask her to compose herself.
Mere facts, badlly stated, do not compose a good book.
sentences.cn: 仅仅有资料, 如果陈述得很糟糕, 并不能组成一本好书;

sentences.en: More than 17.6 million firms compose the business sector of our economy.
sentences.cn: 1,760多万家公司构成了我们经济中的商业部分。

sentences.en: Most software programs allow you to compose emails offline.
sentences.cn: 大部分软件程序允许用户在脱机状态下写电子邮件。

sentences.en: Mozart showed genius even at the age of six, when he began to compose minuets.
sentences.cn: 莫扎特六岁时就开始创作小步舞曲,展露才华.

sentences.en: Protein molecules compose all the complex working parts of living cells.
sentences.cn: 活细胞中所有复杂的运行成分都由蛋白质分子构成。

sentences.en: The force would be composed of troops from NATO countries.
sentences.cn: 该部队将由北约各国的军队组成。

sentences.en: The scene moved him to compose a poem.
These twelve men are believed to compose the jury.
sentences.cn: 据信,陪审团是由这12人组成的.

sentences.en: They must each compose a poem in strict alliterative metre.
sentences.cn: 他们必须每人作一首严格押头韵的诗。

sentences.en: Water is composed of hydrogen and oxygen.
We should compose ourselves in the face of fear.
sentences.cn: 我们在危险时要保持镇静.

words.tran_cn: 作曲家；作家，著作者；设计者
作文，作曲；[材] 构成；合成物
组成；作曲（compose的过去分词）；著作

trans.tran_en: to write a piece of music
to write a piece of music

trans.tran_cn: 组成， 构成； 创作， 为…谱曲； 使平静， 使镇静
trans.tran_en: to write a piece of music
